info.title: Are.na API
info.description:
The Are.na REST API provides programmatic access to the Are.na platform - a tool for connecting ideas and building knowledge together.

**⚠️ Work in Progress**: This v3 API is under active development. Breaking changes may occur. For production use, consider the stable [v2 API](https://dev.are.na).

## Getting Started

All API requests use `https://api.are.na` as the base URL. Responses are JSON with consistent structure including hypermedia links for resource discovery.

## Authentication

Most endpoints work without authentication but provide additional access when authenticated. Use the standard `Authorization` header:

```
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN
```

**Supported Token Types:**
- **OAuth2 Access Token**: Obtained via [OAuth2 flow](#tag/Authentication) (supports PKCE)
- **Personal Access Token**: From [are.na/settings/oauth](https://www.are.na/settings/personal-access-tokens)

For OAuth2, note that the authorization endpoint is hosted on the main site (`www.are.na/oauth/authorize`),
while the token endpoint is on the API (`api.are.na/v3/oauth/token`).

**Authentication Levels:**
- **Public**: No authentication needed (e.g., `/v3/ping`)
- **Optional**: Works unauthenticated but respects permissions when authenticated
- **Required**: Returns `401 Unauthorized` without valid token (e.g., `/v3/me`)

## Rate Limiting

**Acceptable Use**: This API is intended for building applications that integrate with Are.na, not for scraping or bulk data collection. Automated crawling, systematic downloading of content, or any form of structured data harvesting is prohibited. If you need bulk access to data for research or other purposes, please [contact us](mailto:help@are.na) to discuss your use case.

Rate limits are enforced per-minute based on your tier:

| Tier | Requests/Minute |
|------|-----------------|
| Guest (unauthenticated) | 30 |
| Free | 120 |
| Premium | 300 |
| Supporter/Lifetime | 600 |

**Rate Limit Headers** (included in every response):
- `X-RateLimit-Limit`: Your tier's per-minute limit
- `X-RateLimit-Tier`: Current tier (guest/free/premium/supporter)
- `X-RateLimit-Window`: Time window in seconds (always 60)
- `X-RateLimit-Reset`: Unix timestamp when the limit resets

When you exceed limits, you'll receive a `429 Too Many Requests` response with upgrade recommendations and retry timing.

## Request Validation

All parameters are validated against this OpenAPI specification. Invalid requests return `400 Bad Request` with detailed error messages.

## Error Responses

Errors use standard HTTP status codes with JSON bodies:

```json
{
  "error": "Not Found",
  "code": 404,
  "details": {
    "message": "The resource you requested does not exist"
  }
}
```

Common status codes:
- `400`: Invalid request parameters
- `401`: Authentication required or invalid
- `403`: Insufficient permissions
- `404`: Resource not found
- `429`: Rate limit exceeded

BearerAuth.description:
Bearer token authentication.

Accepts two token types:
- OAuth2 access tokens (obtained via OAuth2 flow with Doorkeeper)
- Personal access tokens (from your account settings at are.na/settings)

Example: `Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN`

OAuth2.description:
OAuth 2.0 authentication. See [RFC 6749](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) for details.

**Supported Flows:**
- **Authorization Code**: For web and mobile apps with a backend
- **Authorization Code + PKCE**: For public clients (mobile apps, SPAs) without a client secret
- **Client Credentials**: For server-to-server integrations

PKCE ([RFC 7636](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7636)) is supported for enhanced security with
public clients. Use `code_challenge_method=S256` for best security.

Access tokens do not expire. Register your application at [are.na/oauth/applications](https://www.are.na/oauth/applications).

Links.description:
HATEOAS links for navigation and discovery.
Follows HAL (Hypertext Application Language) format where link relationships 
are expressed as object keys (e.g., "self", "user", "channels").

allOf.description: Link to the current resource (always present)

Link.description:
A hypermedia link containing the URL of a linked resource.
The relationship type is expressed by the key in the parent _links object.

href.description: The URL of the linked resource

html.example: This is only a test.

plain.description: Plain text rendering of the markdown

EmbeddedUser.description: Embedded user representation (used when user is nested in other resources)

slug.description: URL-safe identifier (use this in API paths)

ConnectionContext.description:
Connection metadata that describes how an item is connected to a channel.
This is only present when the item is returned as part of a channel's contents.

position.description: Position of the item within the channel (for manual ordering)

pinned.description: Whether the item is pinned to the top of the channel

connected_at.description: When the item was connected to the channel

connected_by.description: User who connected this item to the channel

EmbeddedGroup.description: Embedded group representation (used when group is nested in other resources)

updated_at.description: When the user was last updated

bio.description: User biography with markdown, HTML, and plain text renderings

UserCounts.description: Counts of various items for the user

channels.description: Number of channels owned by the user

bio.description: Group biography with markdown, HTML, and plain text renderings

updated_at.description: When the group was last updated

GroupCounts.description: Counts of various items for the group

channels.description: Number of channels owned by the group

users.description: Number of users in the group

ContentTypeFilter.description: Filter for content types (blocks and channels)

SearchTypeFilter.description: Filter for searchable content types (includes all content types plus users and groups)

ConnectionSort.description: Sort order for connection lists (channels containing a block/channel, followers)

ChannelContentSort.description: Sort order for channel contents (includes position for manual ordering)

ContentSort.description: Sort order for user/group content lists

Block.description:
A block is a piece of content on Are.na. Blocks come in different types,
each with its own set of fields. Use the `type` field to determine which
fields are available.

BaseBlockProperties.description: Common properties shared by all block types

state.description:
Processing state of the block:
- `available`: Block is ready and fully processed
- `pending`: Block is queued for processing
- `processing`: Block is currently being processed (e.g., image thumbnails, metadata extraction)
- `failed`: Block processing failed (may still be viewable but incomplete)

visibility.description:
Visibility level of the block:
- `public`: Visible to everyone
- `private`: Only visible to the owner
- `orphan`: Block exists but is not connected to any channel

comment_count.description: Number of comments on the block

updated_at.description: When the block was last updated

source.description: Source URL and metadata (if block was created from a URL)

connection.description:
Connection context (only present when block is returned as part of channel contents).
Contains position, pinned status, and information about who connected the block.

TextBlock.description: A text block containing markdown content

content.description: Text content with markdown, HTML, and plain text renderings

ImageBlock.description: An image block containing an uploaded or scraped image

LinkBlock.description: A link block representing a URL with optional preview

content.description: Extracted text content from the link

AttachmentBlock.description: An attachment block containing an uploaded file

image.description: Preview image (for PDFs and other previewable files)

EmbedBlock.description: An embed block containing embedded media (video, audio, etc.)

embed.description: Embed data including HTML and dimensions

url.description: Provider URL (from parsed URI scheme and host)

alt_text.description: Alternative text associated with the image

blurhash.description: BlurHash representation of the image for progressive loading

updated_at.description: When the image was last updated

ImageVersion.description: A resized/processed version of an image with multiple resolution URLs

src_2x.description: 2x resolution image URL for high DPI displays

width.description: Width of the resized image in pixels

height.description: Height of the resized image in pixels

updated_at.description: When the attachment was last updated

body.description: Comment body with markdown, HTML, and plain text renderings

updated_at.description: When the comment was last updated

state.description:
Lifecycle state of the channel:
- `available`: Channel is active and accessible
- `deleted`: Channel has been soft-deleted

visibility.description:
Visibility level of the channel:
- `public`: Anyone can view and connect to the channel
- `private`: Only the owner and collaborators can view
- `closed`: Anyone can view, but only collaborators can add content

updated_at.description: When the channel was last updated

connection.description:
Connection context (only present when channel is returned as part of another channel's contents).
Contains position, pinned status, and information about who connected the channel.

ChannelCounts.description: Counts of various items in the channel

blocks.description: Number of blocks in the channel

channels.description: Number of channels connected to this channel

collaborators.description: Number of collaborators on the channel

post.description:
Exchange credentials for an access token. This is the OAuth 2.0 token endpoint.

**Supported Grant Types:**

- `authorization_code`: Exchange an authorization code for an access token
- `authorization_code` + PKCE: For public clients without a client secret
- `client_credentials`: Authenticate as your application (server-to-server)

**PKCE Support:** For public clients (mobile apps, SPAs), use PKCE by sending
`code_challenge` and `code_challenge_method` in the authorization request, then
include `code_verifier` when exchanging the code. See [RFC 7636](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7636).

Access tokens do not expire and can be used indefinitely. Register your application
at [are.na/oauth/applications](https://www.are.na/oauth/applications) to obtain client credentials.

client_id.description: Your application's client ID (required for all grant types)

client_secret.description: Your application's client secret (required for confidential clients, omit for PKCE)

redirect_uri.description: Redirect URI used in authorization request (required for authorization_code grant)

code_verifier.description:
PKCE code verifier (required when authorization used code_challenge).
Must be 43-128 characters from [A-Z], [a-z], [0-9], "-", ".", "_", "~".

authorization_code.description: Exchange authorization code for token (confidential client)

authorization_code_pkce.description: Exchange authorization code for token (public client with PKCE)

access_token.description: The access token to use for API requests

created_at.description: Unix timestamp when the token was created

value.error_description: The provided authorization grant is invalid, expired, or revoked.
The authorization grant type is not supported.

error_description.example: Client authentication failed due to unknown client or invalid credentials.

get.description:
Search across blocks, channels, users, and groups.

**⚠️ Premium Only**: This endpoint requires a Premium subscription.

**Examples:**
- Simple: `/v3/search?q=brutalism`
- Images only: `/v3/search?q=architecture&type=Image`
- My content: `/v3/search?q=*&scope=my`
- In a channel: `/v3/search?q=design&scope=channel:12345`
- PDFs sorted by date: `/v3/search?q=*&ext=pdf&sort=created_at_desc`

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search query. Use `*` to match everything (useful with filters).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Content types to search (comma-separated).
Block subtypes: Text, Image, Link, Attachment, Embed.
Other: Channel, User, Group, Block (all block types).

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Where to search:
- `all` - Everything (default)
- `my` - Current user's content
- `following` - Content from followed users/channels
- `user:ID` - Specific user's content
- `group:ID` - Specific group's content
- `channel:ID` - Specific channel's content

parameters.name: in
parameters.description:
Fields to search within (comma-separated).
Options: name, description, content, domain, url.
Defaults to all fields.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort order. Options:
- `score_desc` (default) - Relevance
- `created_at_desc`, `created_at_asc`
- `updated_at_desc`, `updated_at_asc`
- `name_asc`, `name_desc`
- `connections_count_desc`
- `random` (use with `seed` for reproducibility)

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Only return results updated after this date (ISO 8601)

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: Random seed for reproducible results (use with `sort=random`)

details.message: This endpoint requires a Premium subscription

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
OAuth 2.0 authentication endpoints. Use these to obtain access tokens
for API requests. Register your application at [are.na/oauth/applications](https://www.are.na/oauth/applications).

**Endpoints:**
- Authorization: `https://www.are.na/oauth/authorize` (user-facing, on main site)
- Token: `https://api.are.na/v3/oauth/token` (API endpoint)

**Supported Flows:**
- Authorization Code: For web/mobile apps with a backend server
- Authorization Code + PKCE: For public clients (mobile apps, SPAs)
- Client Credentials: For server-to-server integrations

PKCE ([RFC 7636](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7636)) is recommended for
all authorization code flows and required for public clients.

tags.name: System
tags.description: Health checks and API metadata (OpenAPI spec, ping)

tags.name: Blocks
tags.description:
Blocks are the fundamental content units on Are.na. They can be text,
images, links, attachments, or embedded media. Blocks can be connected
to multiple channels and have comments.

tags.name: Channels
tags.description:
Channels are collections of blocks and other channels. They can be public,
private, or closed (viewable but not editable). Channels have an owner
(User or Group) and can have collaborators.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
Users are individual accounts on Are.na. Each user has a profile with
channels, followers, and content they've created or saved.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description:
Groups are collaborative organizations that can own channels. Members
of a group can contribute to group-owned channels.

tags.name: Search
tags.description:
Full-text search across blocks, channels, users, and groups. Supports
filtering by type, user, channel, and various metadata fields.

**⚠️ Premium Only**: Search endpoints require a Premium subscription.
